Psalm 103, KJV

**Upload date 6/13/17

Welcome to the third week of memorizing Psalm 103, KJV.

I want you to find a phrase in the psalm that stands out to to you, and incorporate it into your family prayer time. At my home we take turns praying, so everyone gets a chance to make use of their favorite phrase. This is helpful for two reasons.

God’s word is ‘a lamp unto our feet’, and as such it teaches us how to properly address God. We see the most proper expressions of praise there, and while extemporaneous prayer is great, extemporaneous biblical prayer is even better.

Along that line, the psalms tend to express more praise to God than is our comfortable tendency. In Psalm 103 the psalmist calls upon the ‘hosts’ of God to ‘bless’ him - this is bold rhetoric, and strong medicine if we are out of the habit of praising God. Choose almost any phrase from this psalm to use in prayer, and you’ll be moving in a good direction.

Find that a slightly different approach works for you? Share in the comments down below!
